== Main Inclusion Report for plasma-netbook ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/plasma-netbook]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for Kubuntu's Netbook edition as a desktop setup more suited to netbooks then plasma-desktop
** Install dependency of kubuntu-netbook
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=plasma|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=plasma|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root or daemons
** No network activity
** Does not process binary data
** No known source code review
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out the box
** No debconf questions
** Not in Debian
** <nowiki>[[http://websvn.kde.org/trunk/playground/base/plasma/netbook/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is frenetic
** No upstream bug tracker yet
** Hardware: does not deal with hardware, although testing on netbooks is best
** No test suite
0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using standard gettext system
** Package with translatable strings builds a PO template during package build
** End-user applications ship an autostart desktop file
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system cdbs
0. ''Dependencies:''
** KDE, all in main
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Likely to need a fair amount of maintinance for now
** Kubuntu Netbook team is responsible for quality
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it plasma netbook
